block.p: FOX SPORTS NET, Los Angeles and New York, named Tracy Dolgin, chief operating officer, to the post of president. He succeeds Jeff Shell, who becomes president and chief executive at Fox Cable Networks.

GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP, New York, named Daniel M. FitzPatrick managing director at its investment management division. He had been managing director and head of global fiduciary services at J. P. Morgan & Company.

FOX SPORTS NET, Los Angeles and New York, named Tracy Dolgin, chief operating officer, to the post of president. He succeeds Jeff Shell, who becomes president and chief executive at Fox Cable Networks.

GOLDMAN SACHS GROUP, New York, named Daniel M. FitzPatrick managing director at its investment management division. He had been managing director and head of global fiduciary services at J. P. Morgan & Company.
MERRILL LYNCH & CO., New York, named Richard Dunn, risk management chief, to the posts of president and chief executive at a new securities services division.
PERSONIFY INC., San Francisco, named Barry Wright president, succeeding Steve Krause, who becomes chief technology officer. Mr. Wright had been co-president at Aspect Communications.
PROCTER & GAMBLE, Cincinnati, named Steve David, global customer business development officer, to the post of chief information officer. He succeeds Todd Garrett, who retired.
